description:
static_assert further evolves with C++26. Our tool for compile-time assertion will support user-generated error messages. As such, we’ll be able to reuse messages as well as enrich them with information available at compile-time making diagnostics easier to read.

C++26: user-generated static_assert messages

by Sandor Dargo

From the article:

Our first quest into the world of C++26 was about =delete with an optional error message, which improves the readability of the source code and potentially the error messages. In this next part of
title: C++26: user-generated static_assert messages -- Sandor Dargo
